segment.source: Auto configuration settings for Internet Explorer 11
segment.target: Auto configuration settings for Internet Explorer 11

segment.source: Auto configuration settings for Internet Explorer 11 (Internet Explorer 11 for IT Pros)
segment.target: Auto configuration settings for Internet Explorer 11 (Internet Explorer 11 for IT Pros)

segment.source: Auto configuration settings for Internet Explorer 11
segment.target: Auto configuration settings for Internet Explorer 11

segment.source: Automatic configuration lets you apply custom branding and graphics to your internal Internet Explorer installations, running on Windows 8.1 or Windows Server 2012 R2.
segment.target: Automatic configuration lets you apply custom branding and graphics to your internal Internet Explorer installations, running on Windows 8.1 or Windows Server 2012 R2.

segment.source: For more information about adding custom branding and graphics to your IE package, see Customize the toolbar button and Favorites List icons using IEAK 11.
segment.target: For more information about adding custom branding and graphics to your IE package, see Customize the toolbar button and Favorites List icons using IEAK 11.

segment.source: Important
segment.target: Important

segment.source: You'll only see and be able to use the IE Customization Wizard 11 - Automatic Configuration page if you're creating an internal IE installation package.
segment.target: You'll only see and be able to use the IE Customization Wizard 11 - Automatic Configuration page if you're creating an internal IE installation package.

segment.source: For more information about the IE Customization Wizard 11 - Automatic Configuration page, see Use the Automatic Configuration page in the IEAK 11 Wizard.
segment.target: For more information about the IE Customization Wizard 11 - Automatic Configuration page, see Use the Automatic Configuration page in the IEAK 11 Wizard.

segment.source: Adding the automatic configuration registry key
segment.target: Adding the automatic configuration registry key

segment.source: For custom graphics and branding, add the registry key to your IE installation package.
segment.target: For custom graphics and branding, add the registry key to your IE installation package.

segment.source: Important
segment.target: Important

segment.source: Follow these directions carefully because serious problems can occur if you update your registry incorrectly.
segment.target: Follow these directions carefully because serious problems can occur if you update your registry incorrectly.

segment.source: For added protection, back up your registry so you can restore it if a problem occurs.
segment.target: For added protection, back up your registry so you can restore it if a problem occurs.

segment.source: To add the registry key
segment.target: To add the registry key

segment.source: On the Start screen, type regedit, and then click Regedit.exe.
segment.target: On the Start screen, type regedit, and then click Regedit.exe.

segment.source: Right-click the subkey, point to New, and then click Key.
segment.target: Right-click the subkey, point to New, and then click Key.

segment.source: Enter the new key name, , and then press Enter.
segment.target: Enter the new key name, , and then press Enter.

segment.source: Right-click , point to New, and then click DWORD (32-bit) Value.
segment.target: Right-click , point to New, and then click DWORD (32-bit) Value.

segment.source: Enter the new DWORD value name, iexplore.exe, and then press Enter.
segment.target: Enter the new DWORD value name, iexplore.exe, and then press Enter.

segment.source: Right-click iexplore.exe, and then click Modify.
segment.target: Right-click iexplore.exe, and then click Modify.

segment.source: In the Value data box, enter 1, and then click OK.
segment.target: In the Value data box, enter 1, and then click OK.

segment.source: Exit the registry editor.
segment.target: Exit the registry editor.

segment.source: Updating your automatic configuration settings
segment.target: Updating your automatic configuration settings

segment.source: After adding the registry key, you can change your automatic configuration settings to pick up the updated branding.
segment.target: After adding the registry key, you can change your automatic configuration settings to pick up the updated branding.

segment.source: Important
segment.target: Important

segment.source: Your branding changes won't be added or updated if you've previously chosen the Disable external branding of IE setting in the Group Policy object.
segment.target: Your branding changes won't be added or updated if you've previously chosen the Disable external branding of IE setting in the Group Policy object.

segment.source: This setting is intended to prevent branding by a third-party, like an Internet service or content provider.
segment.target: This setting is intended to prevent branding by a third-party, like an Internet service or content provider.

segment.source: For more information about Group Policy, including videos and the latest technical documentation, see the Group Policy TechCenter.
segment.target: For more information about Group Policy, including videos and the latest technical documentation, see the Group Policy TechCenter.

segment.source: To update your settings
segment.target: To update your settings

segment.source: Open the IE Customization Wizard 11, and go to the Automatic Configuration page.
segment.target: Open the IE Customization Wizard 11, and go to the Automatic Configuration page.

segment.source: Choose the Automatically detect configuration settings check box to allow automatic detection of browser settings.
segment.target: Choose the Automatically detect configuration settings check box to allow automatic detection of browser settings.

segment.source: Choose the Enable Automatic Configuration box to let you change the rest of the configuration options, including:
segment.target: Choose the Enable Automatic Configuration box to let you change the rest of the configuration options, including:

segment.source: Automatically configure every box: Type how often IE should check for configuration updates.
segment.target: Automatically configure every box: Type how often IE should check for configuration updates.

segment.source: Typing 0 (zero), or not putting in any number, means that automatic configuration only happens when the computer restarts.
segment.target: Typing 0 (zero), or not putting in any number, means that automatic configuration only happens when the computer restarts.

segment.source: Automatic Configuration URL (.INS file) box: Type the location of your automatic configuration script.
segment.target: Automatic Configuration URL (.INS file) box: Type the location of your automatic configuration script.

segment.source: Automatic proxy URL (.JS, .JVS, or .PAC file) box: Type the location of your automatic proxy script.
segment.target: Automatic proxy URL (.JS, .JVS, or .PAC file) box: Type the location of your automatic proxy script.

segment.source: Important
segment.target: Important

segment.source: Internet Explorer 11 no longer supports using file server locations with your proxy configuration (.pac) files.
segment.target: Internet Explorer 11 no longer supports using file server locations with your proxy configuration (.pac) files.

segment.source: To keep using your .pac files, you have to keep them on a web server and reference them using a URL, like http://share/test.ins.
segment.target: To keep using your .pac files, you have to keep them on a web server and reference them using a URL, like http://share/test.ins.

segment.source: If your branding changes aren't correctly deployed after running through this process, see Auto configuration and auto proxy problems with Internet Explorer 11.
segment.target: If your branding changes aren't correctly deployed after running through this process, see Auto configuration and auto proxy problems with Internet Explorer 11.

segment.source: Locking your automatic configuration settings
segment.target: Locking your automatic configuration settings

segment.source: You have two options to restrict your users' ability to override the automatic configuration settings, based on your environment.
segment.target: You have two options to restrict your users' ability to override the automatic configuration settings, based on your environment.

segment.source: Using Microsoft Active Directory.
segment.target: Using Microsoft Active Directory.

segment.source: Choose Disable changing Automatic Configuration settings from the Administrative Templates setting.
segment.target: Choose Disable changing Automatic Configuration settings from the Administrative Templates setting.

segment.source: Not Using Active Directory.
segment.target: Not Using Active Directory.

segment.source: Choose the Disable changing Automatic Configuration settings setting in the Group Policy object.
segment.target: Choose the Disable changing Automatic Configuration settings setting in the Group Policy object.
